description: Montreal Canadiens-only (MTL) line combination analytics for the 2024-2025 NHL season, including defensive pairings, forward lines, power play units, penalty kill units, and 5-player combinations with advanced performance metrics.

scope.notes: This dataset contains only Montreal Canadiens line combinations for the 2024-2025 NHL season.

files.name: Line_Combinations_Metrics_for_Defencemen.parquet
files.description: Defensive pairing combinations showing time on ice, zone starts, puck possession, and expected goals metrics

files.name: Line_Combinations_Metrics_for_Forwards (1).parquet
files.description: Forward line combinations analyzing chemistry, puck possession, and scoring opportunities

files.name: Line_Combinations_Metrics_for_PPUnits.parquet
files.description: Power play unit combinations with special teams effectiveness and shot generation metrics

files.name: Line_Combinations_Metrics_for_SHUnits.parquet
files.description: Penalty kill unit combinations analyzing defensive structure and shot suppression

files.name: Line_Combinations_Metrics_for_Units.parquet
files.description: 5-player unit combinations representing full team chemistry and deployment strategies

content_examples: Defensive Pairings: Matheson-Hutson - OZst%: 0.521, SOO: 23.14, XGF: 1.20
Forward Lines: Suzuki-Caufield-Slafkovsky - OZst%: 0.395, SOO: 25.10, XGF: 1.15
query_capabilities: Analyze specific line combination performance and chemistry
Compare different player combinations for optimal deployment
Identify strengths and weaknesses of current pairings
Track time on ice and usage patterns for combinations
Assess puck possession and zone control by combination type
sample_queries: What are the most effective defensive pairings by expected goals?
Which forward line combinations have the highest puck possession?
How do power play units perform in terms of expected goals generation?
What penalty kill combinations are most effective at shot suppression?
Which 5-player combinations show the best overall chemistry?
Compare the performance of different Suzuki line combinations
key_insights: Top defensive pairing (Matheson-Hutson) shows strong offensive zone deployment (52.1% OZ starts)
Elite forward line (Suzuki-Caufield-Slafkovsky) leads in puck possession and expected goals
Power play unit with Laine-Suzuki-Caufield-Slafkovsky-Hutson generates highest expected goals
Most effective penalty kill combinations show balanced XGA/XGF ratios
5-unit combinations reveal optimal deployment patterns for different game situations
advanced_features: Chemistry scoring based on historical performance together
Usage pattern analysis showing deployment preferences
Zone start analysis for offensive/defensive deployment
Expected goals differential for combination effectiveness
Time on ice tracking for workload management
